Eat As a Local - Sharing Economy for Foodies

Presenting local cuisine as a full food experience for eveyone

CLIENT University Project (Later a business idea)

DURATION 2 months

CONTRIBUTION Project in a group of 2. Case study parts done by me

üßë‚Äçüîß The Challenge

How to facilitate sharing of experiences among people new to a city through a common interest of local cuisine

ü•Ö Goals


To validate the concept by arranging a real meetup
Goal 1


To actually set up a meetup that earned validating the business model
Goal 2

ü§† Outcomes


Validated the concept by making a sale and hosting a cuisine experience
Outcome 1


Modified the idea via Bites 'n' Boxes to allow people to test pre-prepared recipes by themselves
Outcome 2

üî¨ User Research

A survey and subsequent user interviews seemed the best strategy as I was new in Paris at that time and did not know much abou the local cuisine. My colleague and I recruited 5 regular people and a professional chef for the purpose.

We analysed the result via Thematic Anaysis and categorized the most important concerns as empathy maps.

Excerpts from the survey. You can view the full survery report at Eat as a local survery
Quick insights gathered from the survery and interviews

The participants felt a lack of options to try home made cuisine whether local or their own cuisine

Participants usually used Google or asked their friends about restaurants or food events. Often, it resulted in differing expectations

One participant did not want to host people because he had the shortage of time and he was not very good at cooking. He was open to learn cooking from a professional chef

The chef participant mentioned that chefs already do independent hosting, private sessions, and cooking classes but it is very limited through their own personal contacts. Celebrity chefs are rare

Two participants did not want to go to a stranger's house for a food experience due to security reasons

üßê Competitor Analysis

Ways in which Eat As a Local could have an advantage

  • Provides an organized platform for local as well as professional chefs to find customers
  • Ability to book experiences and cooking classes
  • Ability for Pro Chefs to test experimental dishes
  • Vetted chefs to ensure quality and safety

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Empathy Maps

Empathy map was a great way in this case to understand the two main groups of users. Namely the people looking for local food experiences and chefs.

üë®‚Äçüéì User flowchart

Eatlocal as a platform has two sections: Customers and Chefs. Anyone could be both at the same time and they can switch between chef and customer from the profile. The flowchart gives an idea of structure of the platform and various pages.

üó∫Ô∏è Platform Idea

Brainstorming from the interview transcripts helped us to formulate a C2C platform.

‚ú® Paper Sketches

üåà Hi-Fi Designs - Customers

üì± Mobile Design - Customer

While initially, mobile app design was not planned, I have added it overtime. Few key decisions:

  • Four top categories in main navigation.
  • Explore serves as the homepage and this is most important function of the platform.
  • Reservations shows the current bookings of the user on different dates.
  • Recipes shows blog articles on new and innovative recipes by Eat as a Local
  • Lastly, profile houses account information. It also has "stories" feature to further keep the user in loop of exciting experiences happening in the city.

üë©‚Äçüç≥ Chef Dashboard

Any person could also register as a local cook/chef to provide their services. A chef could manage their offerings, schedule and view statistics on how their business had performed. The design decision were made by ananlyzing the interviews done in the beginnning.

Schedule

Key design decisions:

  • Monthly and weekly views available.
  • The chef can oversee all the events booked and also create new events.
  • Details of a selected event is displayed on the right sidebar.
Catalogue of dishes and experiences

Key design decisions:

  • Catalogue of all the dishes and immersive experiences.
  • The chef can filter them based on various parameters. Important ones are types and allergens.
  • New items in the catalogue can be edited, added, and deleted as desrired.
Analytics

Analytics provides key metrics to the chef about their business performance in the current month and past months. Key decisions:

  • The business overview gives a quick glance at the most important metrics of the business such as revenue and profit.
  • The rest of the visualizations tackle a specific metric. For eg. Place of orders tells the chef which areas of the city had most orders.
  • There is also a good potential to turn this data into intelligent recommendations.

üì± Mobile Design - Chef

Mobile design for the chef dashboard. Few key decisions:

  • The categories from web version are presented in the tab navigation.
  • The mobile version also provides the same functionalities without any loss.

üß™ Usability Test and Reflections

We performed a "usabiltiy test" for the platform using the web prototype and observed the process of going till the order page. It was done with the same participants as in the initial user research. Some of the reflections were as below.

We weren't able to validate the idea of private sessions with a pro chef and we were able to interview only one pro chef

Validate if the customers are more interested in having a food experience with the chef than learning cooking with the chef

The platform is matching travelers with local people to have authentic local food, which may challenge the traditional restaurants

Security concerns regarding quality of food ingredients

üîÆ Future Directions

There can be a standard for certification or vetting process for chefs

Additional information about the dishes. For example, tags about ‚Äúvegetarian‚Äù, and allergens like ‚Äúpeanut‚Äù

An idea was to validate if chefs would be interested to make bookings with people looking to taste new dishes. It gives them creative real estate to experiment

Later on, a friend and I started to work on a concept of providing a cuisine box with exact amount of spices and ingredients. The customers could follow the recipe and test a local cuisine for themselves. We have named it Bites 'n Boxes and did get some interest in orders even though it is a facebook page at the moment.
